messages.subject: Re: feminism
messages.msgSnippet: ... You are conveniently leaving out the bit about feminism being the root of this daycare scourge upon our planet. That s what I objected to. I find that
messages.messageBody:
on 6/28/00 3:37 PM, "Dia Garland" <moocow@...> wrote:

> I see that many on this list condemn those who hold dearly to the conviction
> that children deserve to be raised by their parents and not paid stand ins,
> and quite frankly I am confused by the attitude here.

You are conveniently leaving out the bit about feminism being the root of
this daycare scourge upon our planet. That's what I objected to. I find that
attitude shortsighted and an overgeneralization. I haven't heard anyone on
this list say that they, personally, put their children in daycare for 10
hours a day. I think you'll find that we agree more than disagree. But the
venom towards working mothers disturbs me. Keep your children home. Mine are
home. Who here has condemned that? Please show me.
--
Thea
metta@...
